segments.en: Linked Discourses 7
2. Lay Followers
22. At Khomadussa
So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati khomadussaṃ nāmaṃ sakyānaṃ nigamo.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, where they have a town named Khomadussa.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya khomadussaṃ nigamaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
segments.en: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Khomadussa for alms.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena khomadussakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā sabhāyaṃ sannipatitā honti kenacideva karaṇīyena, devo ca ekamekaṃ phusāyati.
segments.en: Now at that time the brahmins and householders of Khomadussa were gathered in the council hall for some business, while a gentle rain drizzled down.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena sā sabhā tenupasaṅkami.
segments.en: Then the Buddha approached that council.

segments.pli: Addasaṃsu khomadussakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā bhagavantaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.
segments.en: The brahmins and householders saw the Buddha coming off in the distance,
and said,

segments.pli: “ke ca muṇḍakā samaṇakā, ke ca sabhādhammaṃ jānissantī”ti?
segments.en: “Who are these shavelings, these fake ascetics? Don’t they understand the council rules?”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā khomadussake brāhmaṇagahapatike gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha addressed the brahmins and householders of Khomadussa in verse:
“If good people are not present it is no true council;

segments.pli: Santo na te ye na vadanti dhammaṃ;
segments.en: and those whose speak against principle are not good people.
Having given up greed, hate, and delusion,
speakers of principle are good people.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, khomadussakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: When he had spoken, the brahmins and householders of Khomadussa said to the Buddha,
“Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent!

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṃ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
segments.en: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, Master Gotama has made the teaching clear in many ways.

segments.pli: Ete mayaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
segments.en: We go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Upāsake no bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇaṃ gate”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember us as lay followers who have gone for refuge for life.”
The Linked Discourses with Brahmins are complete.

suttaplex.blurb: When the Buddha approaches a brahmin council in session, they complain that he is out of order.
